intro: Goniothalamus panayensis, commonly known as the Panay mountain ash, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests and is known for its ornamental value. It has elliptical leaves with a smooth texture and produces edible fruits that are small and yellowish in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
